content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the primary role of the Mexican executive branch?

choices.label: The primary role of the Mexican executive branch is to determine the constitutionality of laws.
The primary role of the Mexican executive branch is to issue decrees.
The primary role of the Mexican executive branch is to implement and enforce policies.
The primary role of the Mexican executive branch is to ensure that laws are applied fairly to all levels of government.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors of a course country.
